title: Specialist Library Support online publication
description: Our online publication includes posts to help you develop your skills and knowledge in referencing, maths and statistics, copyright, business data, advanced searching and systematic reviews!

title: Specialist Library Support YouTube channel
description: The Specialist Library Support YouTube channel includes video tutorials to help you get started with referencing and statistical software.

title: Start to finish: Statistics
description: Do you need to analyse a set of data and produce some statistics? You do not need to be an expert to produce a statistical report. These resources will give you a basic introduction to statistics and introduce you to producing reports in SPSS.

title: Start to finish: Referencing
description: This set of resources will show you how to reference different types of sources in your assignments. It will help you to cite, paraphrase and manage your references using tools such as EndNote, Endnote online and Mendeley.

title: Using specialist business databases
description: Guides written to help students and researchers to make effective and accurate use of the specialist financial and business databases available at The University of Manchester. The guides are organised by database, including Bloomberg and Datastream.

title: Business Data Service: Virtual Consultation
description: Search some of our previous research consultation enquiries and detailed answers. They cover a selection of financial, economic and business data sources.

title: Finding copyright free images
description: In this post we will explore how you can find and use images without infringing on copyright law.

title: Copyright for teaching materials: can I use it?
description: This short online resource will help you to determine whether you can use specific types of material in your teaching, without breaching copyright.

title: Copyright for student: Who owns what?
description: This resource provides a basic introduction to copyright, whilst looking how it can affect you as a student.

title: SPSS video tutorials
description: This video playlist will help you get started using SPSS.

title: Copyright Guidance at The University of Manchester
description: This guide will help you to find out how copyright affects your work, research and study here at the University of Manchester.

title: Referencing guide at the University of Manchester
description: This guide explores the basics of referencing including key referencing styles used at Manchester and popular referencing software such as Endnote, Mendeley and Zotero.

title: Data and Statistics guide at the University of Manchester
description:
This guide provides information for University of Manchester students and staff on how to understand and use data effectively, support for statistical support and statistics resources for the UK, EU and International regions.
You will find these resources useful for locating statistics in books, journal articles, databases and on the web.

title: Getting started with reference management with Mendeley
description: In this post you will learn how to collect, organise and use your references with Mendeley.

title: Getting started with EndNote desktop
description: In this post we will show you how to get started with EndNote desktop reference management software including; installing EndNote desktop, registering for EndNote online account and creating your EndNote Library.

title: EndNote desktop: collecting references
description: In this post we will show you how to add references to your EndNote desktop library from Library Search and popular databases. You will also learn how add to manual references and attach PDF’s to your references.

title: EndNote desktop: organising your references
description: In this post you will learn how to use groups and remove duplicate references to keep your library organised.

title: EndNote online: collecting references
description: In this post you will learn how to collect references and import them into your EndNote Online library.

title: EndNote online: organising your references
description: It’s easy to build up a long list of references. In this post you will learn how to use groups and remove duplicate references to keep your library organised.

title: EndNote online: formatting your references
description: In this post we explore how you can format your references in Word using EndNote online. Including inserting footnotes, changing your referencing style and inserting citations as you write.

title: EndNote desktop: formatting your references
description: In this post we will explore how to format your references in EndNote desktop, including; changing your referencing style, using the ‘Cite while you write’ plugin, editing your citations, inserting a footnote and producing your reference list.

title: EndNote desktop video tutorials
description: This video playlist will take you through the essential steps to using EndNote desktop software for managing your references.

title: EndNote online video tutorials
description: This video playlist will take you through the essential steps to using EndNote online software for managing your references.

title: Trade and Industry news: an introduction
description: In this post we will explore what Trade and Industry news is and where you can look to find up to date information for your assignments.

title: Trade and industry news: finding specific publications
description: In this post we will explore what the key sources and databases which host Trade and Industry news. Including tips for finding general and company specific information.

title: Making use of MeSH and Suggested Subject Terms
description: In this post we will introduce you to MeSH, and Subject Search Terms to help maximise your search results.

title: Introduction to Health Science databases
description: In this resource we will identify the key functionalities of various health science database platforms and how you can use their tools to broaden your search terms.

title: Locating missing articles in OVID medical databases
description: In this post we will explore how you can locate missing articles in OVID databases such as Medline, Embase and PsycInfo.

title: Understanding your data
description: In this post you will learn about data types and best practices for structuring your data.

title: Introduction to statistics
description: This post will give you a basic introduction to statistical terminology, charts and data types. It will also give you advice on how to organise your data to make it easier to analyse and present.

title: Describing your statistical data
description: We encounter statistics in all areas of our life and it is important that we understand how statistics extract meaning from data. This post will explore the methods and descriptives you can use to describe your data.

title: Systematic review: organising your keywords and subject terms
description: In this post we will explore the keywords and subject headings that you will use to support the early scoping exercises and subsequent literature reviews. We will also explore how MeSH and MeSH trees can help you to  collect, organise and present your search terms.

title: Planning your systematic review
description: In this post we will explore how to get started with your systematic review including planning and refining your search terms.

title: Getting started with your systematic review
description: In this post we explore what systematic reviews are, why we conduct them and how they differ from systematic literature searches.

title: Using frameworks to structure your search
description: In this post we will introduce you to PICO, PECO and SPIDER structured search frameworks. We explore what they are, why they are useful, and how to decide which framework you should use.

title: Advanced search: making use of Boolean operators
description: In this post we will introduce you to Boolean operators, to help you find the most relevant results in your literature search.

title: Market research databases
description: In this post we will look at a number of useful databases, and explore how you can easily begin navigating them to get access to the information that you need

title: CUSIP codes: where it could go wrong
description: In this post we will explain what a CUSIP code is, the common mistakes people make and how to avoid then.

title: Researching company information
description: In this post we will describe the differences between quoted and private companies. We will explain what kind of information you can find about them and their directors.

title: Reshape data in Stata: long to wide
description: In this post we will describe the difference between long and wide panel data, and how to convert from long to wide using the Stata statistical software.

title: Text analysis with NVivo
description: In this post we will introduce NVivo for analysing the text of a set of documents, using company reports as an example.

title: Introduction to mergers and acquisitions
description: In this post we will give you a brief introduction to the key concepts required to take our workshops about finding historical deals.

title: Introduction to data analysis with SAS Enterprise Guide
description: In this post we will introduce you to the SAS Enterprise Guide data analysis tool, using example data sets to demonstrate some of its key functionality.

title: Creating a choropleth map using GeoPandas and financial data
description: In this post we will be using Python and financial data from the WRDS database to create a choropleth map depicting the total revenue of different countries across the world.

title: Introduction to Bloomberg Query Language (BQL)
description: In this post we will describe the new set of Bloomberg formulas called Bloomberg Query Language (BQL), and how using them can stop you from exceeding the monthly download limit in Excel.

title: Introduction to Bloomberg Excel add-in
description: In this post we will describe how to set up the Bloomberg Excel add-in to perform structured, bulk data download.

title: Getting certified with Bloomberg Market Concepts
description: In this post we will describe what the Bloomberg Market Concepts certification course is, why you might want to complete it and how to get started.

title: Introduction to Bloomberg
description: In this post we introduce the Bloomberg terminal and keyboard then show you how to find company financial data, news and screen for custom lists of companies.

title: Introduction to Datastream
description: In this post we introduce the Datastream application and Excel add-in then show you how to find company financial data, economic data and create custom lists of companies.

title: Getting certified with Datastream
description: In this post we will describe what the Datastream certification course is, why you might want to complete it and how to get started.

title: Introduction to SDC Platinum
description: In this post we introduce the SDC Platinum application then show you how to create lists of mergers and acquisitions deals.

title: Researching mergers and acquisitions in Thomson ONE
description: In this post we introduce the Thomson ONE database then show you how to find specific deals and create lists of mergers and acquisitions.

title: Introduction to Thomson ONE reports
description: In this post we show you how to find company and industry reports and filings in the Thomson ONE database.

title: Introduction to Thomson ONE financial statements
description: In this post we show you how to find company financial data in the Thomson ONE database.

title: Getting data in and out of Eventus
description: In this post we show you how to form your data to use the Eventus event study tool, and how to access the data it returns.

title: Getting started with SPSS and calculating descriptive statistics
description: In this post we will show you how to get started with SPSS including; inputting your data into SPSS, calculating descriptive statistics and testing for normality.

title: Running your statistical test in SPSS
description: In this post we will show you how to run common statistical tests in SPSS and report them in APA style.

title: Replicating searches in Health Science databases
description: In this post we will show you how to replicate a search topic in four database platforms and introduce you to the key search tools available.

title: Introduction to the Ovid platform using PsycInfo
description: In this post we will show you how to search for literature in OVID databases, including using key tools such mapping terms to subject headings.

title: Introduction to the EBSCO platform using CINAHL
description: In this post we will show you how to search for literature in CINAHL, including key functionalities such as combining your previous searches.

title: How to save your search in EBSCO
description: In this post we will show you how to create an account and save your searches in EBSCO.

title: Introduction to the Web of Science platform
description: In this post we will introduce to searching for literature within the Web of Science database.

title: How to save your search in Web of Science
description: In this post we will show you how to create an account and save your searches within Web of Science.

title: Introduction to the Proquest platform using ASSIA
description: In this post we will introduce you to carrying out a literature search within the ASSIA database.

title: Introduction to Eikon reports
description: In this post we show you how to find company and industry reports and filings in the Eikon database.

title: Introduction to Eikon financial statements
description: In this post we show you how to find company financial and price data in the Eikon database.

title: Researching mergers and acquisitions in Eikon
description: In this post we introduce the Eikon database then show you how to find specific deals and create lists of mergers and acquisitions.
